DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Site Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results Program Factor One Primary Site Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A one character field to be used when information for a particular primary site needs to be collected by SEER.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Site Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results Program Factor One Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Used when information for a particular primary site needs to be collected by SEER.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredName: Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results Program Factor One Site
Property.preferredDefinition: A cancer registry mandated under the National Cancer Act of 1971 to operate and maintain a population-based cancer reporting system, reporting periodically estimates of cancer incidence and mortality in the United States. The Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results (SEER) Program is a continuing project of the National Cancer Institute of the National Institutes of Health. Among its goals, in addition to assembling and reporting cancer statistics, are the monitoring of annual cancer incident trends and the promoting of studies designed to identify factors amenable to cancer control interventions. (From a brochure of the National Cancer Institute, NIH Publication No. 91-3074, October 1990):Factor; anything that contributes causally to a result.:The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.:Position in relation to the surroundings.

Concepts.longName: Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results Program
Concepts.definition: A program of the National Cancer Institute that provides information on cancer statistics in an effort to reduce the cancer burden among the U.S. population.
Anything that contributes causally to a result.
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
A position in relation to its surroundings.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

Among its goals, in addition to assembling and reporting cancer statistics, are the monitoring of annual cancer incident trends and the promoting of studies designed to identify factors amenable to cancer control interventions. (From a brochure of the National Cancer Institute, NIH Publication No. 91-3074, October 1990)__Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary)_Position in relation to the surroundings._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

Concepts.longName: Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results Program
Concepts.definition: A program of the National Cancer Institute that provides information on cancer statistics in an effort to reduce the cancer burden among the U.S. population.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SEER Site-specifific Coding Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: To be determined for each site where needed. Refer to the most current version of the SEER Program Coding and Staging Manual, for details. Blank Field not coded.
